1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 2 ^ facta est Judéa sanctificáțio ejus~; Isráhel potèstas ejus. ^ Judea was made his sanctuary~; Israel his dominion.
3 ^ Mare vîdit et fuǧívit~; Jordánis convèrsus est retrórsum. ^ The sea saw and fled~; Jordan was turned back.

domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: et colles sicut agni óvium. ^ The mountains skipped like rams
^ When Israel went out of Egypt: and the hills like the lambs of the flock.

column5: qŭia convèrsus es retrórsum~? ^ What ailed thee
column7: that thou didst flee~? And thou

the house of Jacob from a barbarous peo: that ye skipped like rams~? And ye hills

1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 7 ^ A fácie Dòmini mota est terra
^ When Israel went out of Egypt: ^ At the presence of the Lord the earth was moved
the house of Jacob from a barbarous peo: at the presence of the God of Jacob

1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 8 ^ qŭi convèrtuit pètram in stagna aqŭárum
domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: et rupem in fontes aqŭárum. ^ who turned the rock into pools of water
^ When Israel went out of Egypt: and the stony hill into fountains of waters.

column5: super misericórdia tua et veritáte tua
column9: but to thy name give glory
column10: for thy mercy and for thy truth's sake

domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: «~¿~Ubi est Deus eórum~?~». ^ lest the Gentiles should say

1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 11 ^ Deus aŭtem noster in caĕlo~; òmnia qŭaĕcumqŭe vóluit fecit. ^ But our God is in heaven~; he hath done all things whatsoever he would.

domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: ópera mánuum hòminum. ^ The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold
^ When Israel went out of Egypt: works of the hands of men.
et non vidébunt. ^ They have mouths
the house of Jacob from a barbarous peo: and speak not~; they have eyes

^ When Israel went out of Egypt: et non odorábunt. ^ They have ears
the house of Jacob from a barbarous peo: and hear not~; they have noses

^ When Israel went out of Egypt: et non ambulábunt~; non clamábunt in gùtture suo. ^ They have hands and feel not~; they have feet and walk not
the house of Jacob from a barbarous peo: neither shall they cry out through their throat.

1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 16 ^ Sìmiles illîs fiant qŭi fáciunt ea
domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: et òmnes qŭi confídunt in eîs. ^ Let them that make them become like unto them
^ When Israel went out of Egypt: and all such as trust in them.

1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 17 ^ Domus Israhélis sperávit in Dòmino~; adjútor eórum et protéctor eórum est. ^ The house of Israel hath hoped in the Lord~; he is their helper and their protector.
18 ^ Domus Aharónis sperávit in Dòmino~; adjútor eórum et protéctor eórum est. ^ The house of Aaron hath hoped in the Lord~; he is their helper and their protector.

domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: speravérunt in Dòmino~; adjútor eórum et protéctor eórum est. ^ They that fear the Lord have hoped in the Lord~; he is their helper and their protector.
et benedíxit nobîs. Benedíxit dómui Israhélis~; benedíxit dómui Aharónis. ^ The Lord hath been mindful of us
^ When Israel went out of Egypt: and hath blessed us. He hath blessed the house of Israel~; he hath blessed the house of Aaron~;

domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: pusìllîs cum majóribus. ^ he hath blessed all that fear the Lord

1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 22 ^ Adjìciat Dòminus super vos~; super vos et super fílios vèstros. ^ May the Lord add blessings upon you~; upon you and upon your children.

domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: qŭi fecit caĕlum et terram. ^ Blessed be you of the Lord

1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 24 ^ Caĕlum caĕli Dòmino~; terram aŭtem dèdit fíliîs hòminum. ^ The heaven of heaven is the Lord's~; the earth however he has given to the children of men.

^ When Israel went out of Egypt: nèqŭe òmnes qŭi descèndunt in infèrnum. ^ The dead shall not praise thee
column5: nor any of them that go down to hell.

1 ^ In èxitu Isráhel de Aĕǧìpto: 26 ^ Sed nos qŭi vívimus benedícimus Dòmino
domus Jacóbis de pòpulo bárbaro: ex hoc nunc et usqŭe in sáĕculum. ^ But we that live bless the Lord
^ When Israel went out of Egypt: from this time now and for ever.
